org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jndi
Class JNDIConnection

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jndi.JNDIConnection
public class JNDIConnection
extends java.lang.Object

This class models a JNDI connection, as a bean.

It holds various JNDI connection parameters, and provides a connect() method to which will use the provided parameters to generate a corresponding DirContext.

Author:
Eddy Higgins
See Also:
for further information.

Field Detail

DEFAULT_SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION

public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION
The default authentication is simple authentication (username/password)

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

JNDIConnection

public JNDIConnection()
Default constructor for JNDIConnection.

By default, it sets the authentication to DEFAULT_SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION. this can be subsequently changed using setSecurityAuthentication().

Method Detail

setInitialContextFactory

public void setInitialContextFactory(java.lang.String initialContextFactory)
Assign the InitialContextFactory for this connection Object.

Example (LDAP): 

 setInitialContextFactory("com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory");

Parameters:
initialContextFactory - The initialContextFactory to use.

getInitialContextFactory

public java.lang.String getInitialContextFactory()
Return the InitialContextFactory for this connection Object.

Returns:
The configured initialContextFactory

setProviderUrl

public void setProviderUrl(java.lang.String providerUrl)
Assign a provider Url for this connection.

Example: 

 setProviderUrl("ldap://myldapserver.myCompany.com:389");

Parameters:
providerUrl -

getProviderUrl

public java.lang.String getProviderUrl()
Get the provider URL for this connection.

Returns:
String containing the provider URL.

setAlternateProviderUrl

public void setAlternateProviderUrl(java.lang.String alternateProviderUrl)
Assign an alternate provider Url for this connection. This is used only if there is a problem accessing the primary provider URL.

Example: 

 setAlternateProviderUrl("ldap://myldapserver.myCompany.com:389");

Parameters:
alternateProviderUrl -

getAlternateProviderUrl

public java.lang.String getAlternateProviderUrl()
Get the alternate provider URL for this connection.

Returns:
String containing the alternate provider URL.

setSecurityAuthentication

public void setSecurityAuthentication(java.lang.String securityAuthentication)
Set the authentication type to use for this connection.

Example: 

 setProviderUrl("ldap://myldapserver.myCompany.com:389");

Parameters:
securityAuthentication - String which defines the type to use.

setSecurityPrincipal

public void setSecurityPrincipal(java.lang.String securityPrincipal)
Assign a security principal for this connection.

Example: 

 setSecurityPrincipal("uid=user1001,ou=ApplicationAccounts,ou=Resources,o=myCompany.com");

Parameters:
securityPrincipal - String containing the security principle to use for the connection

public java.lang.String getSecurityPrincipal()

public void setSecurityCredentials(java.lang.String securityCredentials)
Set the security credentials for this connection.

Example: 

 setSecurityCredentials("myTrickyPassword");

Parameters:
securityCredentials - A String containing the credentials to use.
